title: Greeter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview not too hard. Tell me about yourself and what can you can contribute to our role. What are your hobbies.Around 30 minutes interview. Last, she asked what is your availability.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. How do you take a leadership role.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Great place to work very friendly. Everyone knows each other. I would work here to retired and live a good life. the view is beautiful from the windows. They have 1199

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy to complete. Great group of coworkers and work environment to be around on a daily basis. Fast paced work system and engaging environment. St. John's Episcopal is a great place to be surrounded
Interview Questions: What are the days/hours to be worked?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled interview, they never forwarded the call-in info so I had to wait around for hours until recruiter rescheduled.  Second time around, they never got on the call so I was ghosted. Again, waiting around for hours and then days to hear back. They decided to go with other candidates. Pretty unprofessional. Wasted my time prepping for interviews, seeking advice from peers and actually waiting around the day of for why they never called in.

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was not very unusual. The staff was friendly and informative. Because it’s Human Resources, the hope is that it would be unremarkable. The interview questions were standard.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (Rochester, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional. She did not have me waiting in the lobby for no more than 5 minutes. She welcomed me with open arms to the job. She gave me a very detailed description on the job and its duties. I was also able to get a tour. The experience was great overall.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
2 rounds of interview-
1) Phone Interview
2) In Person Interview

The interview lasted for 30 minutes and the questions were pretty generic and simple.
It would be a good idea to negotiate about your salary while you are still interviewing.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital
Interview Descriptions: They will ask medical questions so be prepared. Nothing special, this is a community program will offer you a pre-match if they like you. They will give you a short tour at the end.
Interview Questions: Are you ready to work hard?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was awesome. pretty quick, to the point questions and decision was made in a day.
They asked about background, 5 year goals, weakness and strengths, They also asked me the future goals and my IT skills
Interview Questions: They asked me about Vlook ups and other excel functions

title: Hospital Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (Far Rockaway, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I arrived 15 mins early, was pretty easy with mostly simple questions. Spent most of the time talking about the position and responding to my questions. Be prepared for the sheer amount of papers that need to be filled out after the interview, note that it also will take a while to be processed so be sure to complete the process as soon as possible.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to volunteer here?
Name a time you showed compassion for others?
Name a time you've displayed teamwork?

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (Hartford, CT) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers basically check your personality, communication skills, future goals and the reason why you are interested in the job.

title: Medical Billing Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at St. John’s Episcopal Hospital (Bethpage, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was a very simple process because the department was run by a respectful person who saw potential in everyone
Interview Questions: When asked if I would be willing to travel the hospital
